job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Clayton, NC
pros: Great base pay and incentive bonus. on call pay time and half.
cons: Busy, fast past environment. If you are not self sufficient, self motivated, you will not make it.

review_title: Decent Pay Terrible For Work Life/Balance
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Angier, NC
pros: Pay and incentive bonus (before the merge which was not taxed at 40%); very good healthcare, but good luck having time to take care of yourself with the increasing needs of the department.
cons: Upper management does not handle concerns; good luck using your PTO if you like to plan ahead don't count on your requests being returned in a decent time frame; Since I've started the name of the game is bait and switch I was not given the hours I was promised nor the job assignment I was promised from the start. If you value a life outside of work this may not be the place for you as they are always extremely understaffed with no answer as to why they are not hiring. If you want to transfer or find other opportunities within UNC you will be blocked. Management does different rules to different people and enforces those rules according to who they want them to apply to. Overall the culture and environment is extremely Toxic.

cons: ED is rude, kill em with kindness

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Smithfield, NC
pros: Sometimes you have nice people you work with
cons: Low pay, hard work, understaffed, etc

review_title: Johnston Health....the next hospital system to be purchased by Duke or Wake Med.
pros: The majority of the workforce is local lifetime citizens of the area.  It's one of the top 3 employers in the county.  You see and work with people you've known all of your life everyday and get to help them feel better.
cons: Senior management is mostly transplants from other areas of the US who seem to resent and look down their noses at the citizens of the county they work for.  They are for the most part two faced who smile and glad hand in public but plot in meetings to squeeze that dollar to death and it doesn't make a difference who it hinders as long as they are not part of the equation.  The CEO of this organization has the board of commissioners and trustees completely snowed with his personality.

job_title: Patient Financial Counselor in Smithfield, NC
pros: Good benefits , decent hours and co workers
cons: Staff is overwork and are not appreciated. The manager loves to gossip with employees about other staff members and she live to pass the buck. I’ve never seen her do anything but attend meetings. She don’t have a clue how to do her staff members jobs and is not helpful in anyway form or fashion.

Strict about overtime, but that's almost anywhere nowadays.
